Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: A[C#M]mazing g[A]race, how s[E]weet the s[B]ound That s[C#M]aved a w[A]retch like m[E]e [B] I o[C#M]nce was l[A]ost, but n[E]ow I’m f[B]ound T’was b[C#M]lind, but n[A]ow I s[E]ee so cl[B]early
VERSE 2: Was g[C#M]race that t[A]aught my h[E]eart to f[B]ear And g[C#M]race my f[A]ears reli[E]eved [B] How p[C#M]recious d[A]id that g[E]race app[B]ear The h[C#M]our I f[A]irst beli[E]eved [B]
CHORUS: [C#M] Hallelu[A]jah, grace like r[E]ain falls d[B]own on me [C#M] Hallelu[A]jah, all my st[E]ains are washed aw[B]ay Their washed away [C#M] [A] [E] [B]
VERSE 3: When w[C#M]e’ve been th[A]ere ten th[E]ousand y[B]ears Bright sh[C#M]ining a[A]s the s[E]un [B] We’ve n[C#M]o less d[A]ays to s[E]ing God’s pr[B]aise Than w[C#M]hen we f[A]irst beg[E]un [B]
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 amazing grace how sweet the sound that saved a wretch like me i once was lost but now im found twas blind but now i see so clearly verse 2 was grace that taught my heart to fear and grace my fears relieved how precious did that grace appear the hour i first believed chorus hallelujah grace like rain falls down on me hallelujah all my stains are washed away their washed away verse 3 when weve been there ten thousand years bright shining as the sun weve no less days to sing gods praise than when we first begun
